channel.title: [PI] Players can connect to my server but i can't connect to my server [HELP]
channel.description: Hmm, My friends can connect to my server but i can' play on my own server lol?? how ??

item.title: [PI] Players can connect to my server but i can't connect to my server [HELP]
item.dc:creator: @Mod-Vlad Mod-Vlad-
item.description:
@Mod-Vlad wrote:

[quote=“mikexd5, post:7, topic:391609”][quote author=mr pker01 link=topic=488770.msg3573139#msg3573139 date=1303207263]
Still not working!
[/quote]

umm… did you Portforward correctly?[/quote]
You asking if he portforwarded correctly.
Maybe I’m wrong, but like I’ve readed above, HE can’t connect to his server, but others can!?
Lol.

mr pker01:

Hmm, My friends can connect to my server but i can’ play on my own server lol?? how ??

Basically, if you are hosting the server, you easily may connect with 127.0.0.1
But I’m not good with PI so, soz mate. I really can’t help with it.

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Players can connect to my server but i can't connect to my server [HELP]

item.title: [PI] Players can connect to my server but i can't connect to my server [HELP]
item.dc:creator: @DannyIsSoPro DannyIsSoPro
item.description:
@DannyIsSoPro wrote:

Yeah I know, im just really lazy to explain.

Bu basicly, waht he needs to do is copy his public client and make the copy connect to 127.0.0.1

I’m just going to explain it for him.

Take the client that your friends play on.

Copy it, and paste it, rename it host client or something.

Go inside, open client.java and make the first IP your No-IP

The second Ip should be set to 217.0.0.1

Now you should be able to logon.

Now for an example.

The client your friends use should look like this in client.java.

	server = "your no-ip";
	//server = "your no-ip";

yours client should look like this in client.java.

	server = "your no-ip";
	//server = "127.0.0.1";

Hope I helped, even though I’m realy tired, and off task. >.<

Have fun.

Read full topic
